channel.title: Hidden Lambda in Lost Season 6 Episode 2?
channel.description:
Ok, so I'm pretty sure we all know of the Lost easter egg in Half Life 2: Episode Two. It's the one with the number sequence: "4 8 15 16 23 42", along with the Dharma Initiative (you can look it up if you don't know what I'm talking about).
Anyway, I believe I have found an easter egg in Lost Season 6 episode 2. It occurs approximately 17:58 minutes into the episode. It is when Jack is walking in the testing room to find out what is going on with Sayid. Here's a picture of it:
[img]https://pix.gbatemp.net/105662/lambda.JPG[/img]
So, what do you guys think? It could after all, just be a coincidence, but I though it was pretty neat.

item.title: Hidden Lambda in Lost Season 6 Episode 2?
item.dc:creator: Madcat1030
item.description:
Jingles:

Where can I Find that game?

There is indeed a lost video game. I got it from a friend just to see how horrible it was. Got to like… sequence three, right after those tardholes got back from recovering the radio from the pilot’s chamber of the plane.

Read full topic

Vampire95:

Well, I have read that the Half-Life team had taken that easter egg refering to lost, because the lost series had things in it referring to Half-Life. So I think you’re right. :freeman:

This thread has been officially declared dead, stop trying to resuscitate it.

item.title: Hidden Lambda in Lost Season 6 Episode 2?
item.dc:creator: Vampire95
item.description:
Lateralus:

Ok, so I’m pretty sure we all know of the Lost easter egg in Half Life 2: Episode Two. It’s the one with the number sequence: “4 8 15 16 23 42”, along with the Dharma Initiative (you can look it up if you don’t know what I’m talking about).

Anyway, I believe I have found an easter egg in Lost Season 6 episode 2. It occurs approximately 17:58 minutes into the episode. It is when Jack is walking in the testing room to find out what is going on with Sayid. Here’s a picture of it:

So, what do you guys think? It could after all, just be a coincidence, but I though it was pretty neat.

Well, I have read that the Half-Life team had taken that easter egg refering to lost, because the lost series had things in it referring to Half-Life. So I think you’re right. :freeman:

Read full topic

item.title: Hidden Lambda in Lost Season 6 Episode 2?
item.dc:creator: etb513
item.description:
acade365:

that video is shit. it is now possible to do it;

https://www.wired.com/magazine/2010/02/ff_algorithm/

Ehh sort of,

They can sharpen things and try to get a feel for what it would look like if it were a high-res image, but they cannot “enhance” to the point that we see so often in movies and tv today.

It’s sort of like the new Photoshop algorithms that will generate missing sections of a picture for you based on what’s given - it’s what you might think it would look like, but we can’t really see what’s there. It really depends on just how bad the image is.

Read full topic
item.source: Hidden Lambda in Lost Season 6 Episode 2?

item.title: Hidden Lambda in Lost Season 6 Episode 2?
item.dc:creator: Comrade_Tiki
item.description:
MysticJ:

the only “nod” to HL in LOST was the arabs playing HL:

  • “Shit, I’m out of ammo!”
  • “Try the crowbar!”
  • “The crowbar only works on zombies!”

That was one of the best moments of television of all time. Even if it was the PS2 version
